properties.address: Claremount Methodist Church, Merseyside CH45 6UE
properties.description: On Thursday from 1pm till 4 pm we operate a social supermarket/warm hub where people congregate drinking tea etc. On Friday 10.30 am till 2.0 pm we have a community coffee morning with social supermarket available. Light lunch/chat/games - maybe singing.
properties.title: Claremount Hub

properties.address: 2 Jubilee Drive, LIVERPOOL, Merseyside L7 8SL
properties.description: Dave's Botanical CoffeeShop is situated in the basement of City Church Liverpool. Access is via a short flight of stairs or a stairlift. Disabled toilets are available. Come along to our weekly (unless otherwise stated on our Website Calendar) 'Social CafÃ©' on a Friday evening . We have a shelves of board-games available to play, and there's often a jigsaw puzzle on the go! Or just come and enjoy the space, and have a chat and a cuppa ðŸ™‚. We also host a Community Meal on the first Tuesday of most months - which includes a free hot meal and a good opportunity for some social connection. Please see more details here; https://www.citychurchliverpool.org/whats-on
properties.title: Dave's Botanical CoffeeShop

properties.address: 192 Greasby Rd, Greasby, Wirral
properties.description: Friendship Cafe Oasis
properties.title: Greasby Methodist Church

properties.address: 123-129 Linacre Road, Litherland, Merseyside L21 8NS
properties.description: We provide a free hot and cold lunch to all who attend , including fruit , snacks and plenty of teas and coffees . Our kitchen closes at 3:30 but we stay open until 4:00pm we have board games available such as chess, dominoes cards
properties.title: Linacre's Welcome Space

properties.address: St. Oswalds Church Centre, Merseyside L30 5RD
properties.description: An enhanced warm space with hot snacks, drinks, activities. Open for all
properties.title: Ozzyâ€™s Kichen

properties.address: St HIlda's Church Hall, Hunts Cross, Liverpool L25 0NJ
properties.description: Everyone of any age is welcome to come along, chat, keep warm and enjoy free hospitality including: hot and cold snacks, biscuits, fruit, crisps, hot and cold drinks. We have toys, large soft play building equipment, giant connect 4, table tennis, pool, arts and crafts, knitting, Lego, marble run, table football and a play kitchen.
properties.title: St Hilda's Place of Welcome

properties.address: The Hub@ St Peter's,, Woolton, Liverpool L25 5JF
properties.description: We are open as a Warm Welcome Space between 9am and 1pm Monday to Friday throughout the year, except for bank holidays and the weeks after Christmas and Easter. Anyone and everyone is welcome to come in and enjoy a hot drink and a biscuit or snack for free whenever they want to. Volunteers are around to chat and we've lots of books and games you are very welcome to use. We offer a variety of activity sessions run by volunteers throughout the week; a few of them have a low cost for resources or food. Many activities run for free with a voluntary contribution of Â£1pp for a drink and a snack or piece of cake. If you're going through a tough time and would like to join these sessions, please enjoy them for free.
properties.title: The Hub @ St Peter's, Woolton

properties.address: Fazakerley community hub, Merseyside L10 7LQ
properties.description: The space is open to all, have breakfast with a cup of tea or coffee, and enjoy the activities that are on. And some hot home made soup, to either take home or enjoy in the hub.
properties.title: warm hub

properties.address: Fazakerley Methodist Church, Merseyside L9 7AD
properties.description: We will offer the Warm Space to the local community, called advertised as â€˜Welcome Spaceâ€™. There will be hot drinks served and a selection of cakes and biscuits. The session will run from 10.00am until 12 noon. There will be an activity offered such as knitting; Christmas craft; other seasonal craft; visitors talk from the community i.e.: LEAP (Warm Funding) CAP Christians against poverty. Toilet facilities are also available to attendees, including disabled access and nappy changing. Pre-school children will be welcome to this event, and activities can be provided if necessary. This will be advertised in the local supermarkets, schools and community library and Fazakerley Federation. It will also be communicated to the housing association Cobalt who are a strong presence in this area.
properties.title: Welcome Space
